label: A3BC_tP5_99_ac_b_a-002
title: Tetragonal PZT [Pb(Zr$_{x}$Ti$_{1-x}$)O$_{3}$] Structure
comments:
This is a tetragonal ferroelectric distortion of \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_cP5_221_a_c_b-001}{the cubic perovskite structure, $E2_{1}$}. In Pb(Zr$_{x}$Ti$_{1-x}$)O$_{3}$ (aka PZT) it is found for $x \le 0.52$. Although the first (2b) site is nearly equally occupied by zirconium and titanium atoms, the pictures use Zr atoms. Compare this to the \href{current_web_home_dir/A3BC_mC10_8_ab_a_a-001}{monoclinic PZT structure}. 
 To recover the cubic perovskite structure, take $c=a, ~ z_{1}=0, ~ z_{2}=1/2, ~ z_{3} = 0, ~ z_{4} = 1/2$. 
 This structure has the same space group and occupied Wyckoff positions as the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C_tP5_99_b_ac_a-001}{tetragonal BaTiO$_{3}$ structure}, but the displacements from the cubic perovskite structure are different, so we give this structure its own AFLOW designation.
